properties.name: 17th century village
properties.description: Posted by Jason this is where we lived till we got the pad in the city. it was stunning on a foggy morning. go here and rent a canoe to paddle around the canals!!!!!!!! or just walk the village. hardly anything to buy here, a few tiny shops with basics.

properties.name: Apple Tree - free apples
properties.description: Posted by Jason  fresh small crisp apples

properties.name: Aurora - Where to get foreign converters and stuff.
properties.description: Posted by JasonVijzelstraat, Amsterdam, NLHuge Radio Shack style place, near the Pathe\' Theatre. Closes early though. For computers you just need a shape shifter, you don\'t need an actual voltage converter, youru power supply should do that on it\'s own.

properties.name: Overtoom 301 Squat
properties.description: Posted by JasonOvertoom 301, amsterdam, west side of VondelparkIn the hull of an old film school, this gov\'t sanctioned community squat hosts various noise events, but my favorite is the nearly regular (monday nights) Kraakgeluiden, where various "musicians" are matched up and given a week to practice. The place is very professional, has seen tons of structural and code imporvements and isn\'t intimidating as some squat scenese can be. Think of it as a sorta of really fringe jazz scene, in fact this is how people treat the shows, very reverently. If you come late, come in quietly.

properties.name: Topenmuseum
properties.description: Posted by JasonNE corner of OosterPark, Amsterdam, NLTropical cultures museum stuffed with artifacts from the colonial periods that made the Netherlands so well connected. Some really fascinating exhibits, they do a great job creating immersive, walk through and sit and play bits, like the mexican cafe, with wrestling on the tv, and the iranian tea house with live news on the radio, and slippers to put on.

properties.name: Tun Fun, Trampoline Playground (HUGE)
properties.description: Posted by Jason    Waterlooplein, Amsterdam, NLAn enormous underground parking structure converted into a rowdy super padded climbing wonderland for kids. Full cafe and beer, free for parents, indoor soccer, dance party area, stuff for tiny ones too.

properties.name: Westergasfabriek
properties.description: Posted by Jason  Gas Plant converted to community arts facility

properties.name: Wynand Fockink
properties.description: Posted by Bfoote Pijlsteeg 31 - 1012 HH Amsterdamspirits

properties.name: big heron chills here
properties.description: Posted by Jason used to be the chillin grounds of a huge heron, who would not fly away, but would chill on top of parked cars right here everyday, worth a peek if you are around this place

properties.name: canoe rental
properties.description: Posted by Jason  rent some boars and tour the canals, it\'s lovely, bring food for picnic

properties.name: entrepotdok cafe
properties.description: Posted by Jason  nothing super special, just a little cozy cafe of locals

properties.name: film museum
properties.description: Posted by Jason sometimes doing summer outdoor movies, very nice

properties.name: hillside as a supermarket roof
properties.description: Posted by Jason this steep inclined hill is the roof of an underground supermarket, grab some bread and famous dutch sandwich spread and kick it here for lunch

properties.name: huge squat
properties.description: Posted by Jason not sure the name of it, but around back people hang out, and they do parties, the coolest thing is that they have a bridge over the bridge!

properties.name: media art center cafe
properties.description: Posted by Jason i can\'t recall if they simply hold media art festivals here periodically, or if the place is somehow dedicated to this kind of thing, but the entry of the cafe has tons of flyers of stuff going on in this vein.

properties.name: squat bakery
properties.description: Posted by Jason  they have posted hours, which are slightly erratic, but they bake bread, treats, pizzas (sorta), mostly to take away, but also have a little cafe inside

properties.name: street market (eastern)
properties.description: Posted by Jason more about exotic groceries and household goods, this market is primarily offering exotic imported ingredients from former colonies and beyond., walk all the way through Dapperstraat for many many blocks of market.

properties.name: temporary beach
properties.description: Posted by Jason this is one place they had a temporary beach, not sure if it was a recurring location though

properties.name: waterlooplein market
properties.description: Posted by Jason huge second hand marketplace, seems like it\'s open everyday, furniture, army stuff, diy, clothes, tech, music, everything
